sentences: Indira Levak (née Vladić; born 15 September 1973) is a Croatian singer.
She was the lead vocalist of a Croatian dance music trio, Colonia.
Indira was born to Croatian father Franjo and Bosniak mother Ismeta on 15 September 1973 in Županja.
She was named after then-Prime Minister of India Indira Gandhi.
At the age of twelve she became a member of Županja Brass Band, where she played clarinet for thirteen years.
In eighth grade she founded a band with four colleagues - "Forever young".
From 1996 to 2017 she was a member of popular dance group Colonia.
She was married to Narcis Mujkić, but they divorced.
Since 2015, she is a judge of Croatian version of The Voice.
